author: Staff Reporter
text:
Asaripallam police have registered a case against three retired employees of the Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC) in connection with the alleged attack on N. Nagendran (58), Managing Director, Tirunelveli Division of TNSTC on Friday.

According to police, the members of Retired Employees Union of TNSTC met Mr. Nagendran at the office of the General Manager, TNSTC, Nagercoil Region at Ranithottam and insisted upon getting the terminal benefits and DA arrears settled to them.

Sources said that the union members were given assurance by Mr. Nagendran that their dues would be settled as early as possible.

Mr. Nagendran was allegedly attacked by a few retired employees after an altercation while he was about to board his official car to proceed to Tirunelveli.

On the basis of the complaint lodged by Mr. Nagendran, Asaripallam police have registered a case against union leaders of retired employees union – Ayyadurai (65), Robinson (60) and Anantha Krishnan (60) under sections 341 (wrongful restraint), 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 353 (using criminal fore to deter public servant from discharging his duty) and 506 (I) (criminal intimidation). Further investigations are on.

title: Attack on TNSTC MD: cases filed against three retired staff
